snippet: ZAREMBSKI--Rose. Rose Goldberg was born in Warsaw, Poland in 1922. She was 17 years old when the Nazis invaded. Strong in spirit and in mind, she survived the Warsaw Ghetto and multiple concentration camps-the sole member of her family. After the war, she married a fellow survivor, Sam Zarembski in a Displaced Persons camp in Europe and the two moved to New York to start a new life. Rose used her many creative talents to find work as a seamstress, and became a member of the International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union. She had two children, Allan and Frieda. Rose went on to be a grandmother and later a great-grandmother. Rose's home was always filled with the smell and warmth of Jewish tradition, and today her legacy lives on through her recipes and her devoted family. 1/3
